google: The most widely used search engine.
bing: A web search engine owned and operated by Microsoft.
duckduckgo: A search engine that emphasizes protecting searchers' privacy.
yahoo: A web services provider known for its search engine.
baidu: A Chinese search engine known for its comprehensive results.
ask: A question-answering website that uses a search engine for results.
aol: A web portal and online service that features a search engine.
startpage: Private search engine that emphasizes user privacy.
yandex: A Russian search engine that also provides various services.
dogpile: Metasearch engine that retrieves results from various search engines.
webcrawler: Early search engine that aggregates results from other engines.
lycos: One of the original search engines that now features directories.
iknow: Web search engine that emphasizes user interaction.
qwant: Search engine that respects user privacy.
metacrawler: Search engine that aggregates results from various search engines.
factbites: Search engine that provides summaries of information.

facebook: Connect with friends and family on this social media platform.
twitter: A platform for public self-expression and conversation in real time.
instagram: Photo and video sharing social networking service.
tiktok: An app for creating and sharing short videos.
linkedin: Professional networking site for career and business.
pinterest: A visual discovery engine for finding ideas and inspiration.
myspace: Social networking site known for its music community.
tumblr: A microblogging platform and social network.
wechat: A multi-purpose messaging, social media, and mobile payment app.
vk: Popular social media platform in Russia.
parler: A web-based social networking service promoting free speech.
gab: Social media platform for free speech.
clubhouse: Audio-based social networking app for live discussions.
telegram: Messaging app emphasizing privacy and security.
discord: Voice, video, and text chat platform designed for gamers.
nextdoor: Social network for neighborhoods to connect and share.
meetup: Platform for finding and building local communities.
myheritage: Genealogy website that integrates social networking.
deviantart: Online community showcasing various forms of user-made artwork.
quibb: Social network for professional sharing and discussion.
ello: Creative network and social media platform.

gmail: Google's email service with ample storage and features.
yahoo: A free email service offered by Yahoo.
protonmail: Secure email service with end-to-end encryption.
zoho: An email hosting service with collaboration tools.
mailchimp: Email marketing service and marketing automation platform.
fastmail: Email service offering privacy and customization options.
hushmail: Secure email service focusing on privacy.
mailjet: Email service provider focusing on transactional and marketing emails.
sendinblue: Email marketing service with automation tools.
yandex: Russian email service with various features.
avaaz: Global activism organization providing email services.

drive: Cloud storage service from Google for files and documents.
dropbox: File hosting service offering cloud storage and synchronization.
box: Cloud storage service that allows businesses to manage files.
pcloud: Cloud storage service that allows users to store files.
mega: Cloud storage and file hosting service known for security.
sync: Secure cloud storage with end-to-end encryption.
mediafire: File hosting and cloud storage service.
backblaze: Cloud backup service for personal and business use.
s3: Scalable object storage service for developers.
hubic: Online storage service allowing users to store files in the cloud.
zoolz: Cloud storage service focusing on archiving.
idrive: Online backup and hosting service with multiple features.
folder: Cloud storage solution for protecting files.
digi: Online storage service focusing on simplicity and speed.

youtube: Video sharing platform for user-uploaded videos.
netflix: Subscription-based streaming service for TV shows and movies.
hulu: Streaming service with live and on-demand TV.
prime: Streaming service included with an Amazon Prime account.
vimeo: Video hosting service for user-generated content.
disney: Streaming service featuring Disney, Pixar, Marvel, and more.
twitch: Live streaming platform primarily for gamers.
dailymotion: Video sharing platform for user-generated and professional content.
paramount: Streaming platform with live and on-demand entertainment.
crunchyroll: Streaming service specializing in anime and manga.
funimation: Service focused on dubbed and subbed anime content.
hbomax: Streaming service featuring HBO's premium content.
shudder: Streaming service for horror, thriller, and suspense films.
fubo: Streaming service specializing in live sports and TV.
freevee: Free streaming service from Amazon with ads.
plex: Media server platform that allows streaming of personal content.
vLive: Live streaming app primarily for K-pop and entertainment.

amazon: Largest internet retailer, providing a wide variety of products.
etsy: Marketplace for handmade and vintage items.
walmart: Online presence of the largest grocery retailer in the USA.
bestbuy: Retail establishment specializing in consumer electronics.
alibaba: Online marketplace connecting businesses with suppliers.
rakuten: E-commerce platform known for cash-back shopping.
newegg: E-commerce site specializing in computer hardware.
wayfair: Online retailer specializing in home goods and furniture.
aliexpress: Online retail service based in China.
chewy: Online retailer specializing in pet food and products.
poshmark: Social commerce platform for buying and selling fashion.
depop: Mobile app for buying and selling fashion and accessories.
thredup: Online consignment store for secondhand clothes.
dhgate: E-commerce website connecting buyers with Chinese wholesalers.
myhabit: Online shopping site for fashion and lifestyle products.
wish: Online shopping platform featuring discounted products.
target: Retailer with a strong online shopping presence.

cnn: Provides breaking news, analysis, and opinion.
bbc: British public service broadcaster providing news worldwide.
guardian: British news organization known for its coverage of global events.
nytimes: American newspaper recognized as a leading source of news.
aljazeera: State-funded broadcaster in Qatar providing global news.
reuters: International news organization known for credible news coverage.
buzzfeed: Digital news organization providing news and culture stories.
forbes: Business news and financial information organization.
vox: Online news site providing analysis and commentary.
abc: News division of the American Broadcasting Company.
nbc: News division of the NBC television network.
mirror: UK tabloid newspaper website for news and entertainment.
epoch: Global news organization focusing on investigative journalism.
washington: American newspaper known for its investigative journalism.
financial: International daily newspaper focused on business and economics.
politico: Political news organization focusing on U.S. politics.
thehill: News outlet focusing on U.S. politics.
axios: News website that focuses on business and politics.
scmp: South China Morning Post, a Hong Kong-based English-language newspaper.

spotify: Digital music service with millions of songs.
apple: Music service from Apple with a vast library.
tidal: Music streaming service known for high fidelity sound quality.
deezer: Music streaming service with millions of tracks.
amazon: Streaming service included with Amazon Prime.
soundcloud: Music sharing platform that allows users to upload and share music.
iheart: Internet radio platform providing live radio stations.
youtube_music: Music streaming service developed by YouTube.
napster: Music subscription service formerly known as Rhapsody.
qobuz: Streaming service specializing in high-resolution audio.
anghami: Arabic music streaming service offering a wide selection of songs.
radio: Curated radio stations integrated into the Apple Music service.
live365: Internet radio platform for live music streaming.
lastfm: Music discovery service that tracks listening habits.
slacker: Internet radio and music streaming service.
tunein: Internet radio service offering live streaming of radio stations.
shazam: Music identification service that suggests songs.

mashable: Global entertainment and tech media company.
wired: Emerging technologies affecting culture, economy, and politics.
verge: News website focusing on the intersection of technology and culture.
engadget: Covers the intersection of technology and gaming.
gizmodo: Design, technology, and science news blog.
venturebeat: Tech news and analysis platform focused on disruptive tech.
next: Business and tech site focused on the future.
zdnet: Business technology news and reviews site.
microsoft: Official blog of Microsoft providing news and updates.
google: Official blog of Google sharing news and updates.
hacker: Social news website for sharing technology-related articles.
android: News, reviews, and insights on Android devices.
theverge: Covering the intersection of technology, science, art, and culture.

steam: Digital distribution platform primarily for PC gaming.
epic: Digital video game storefront known for Epic exclusives.
itch: Platform for indie games allowing developers to upload their games.
xbox: Microsoft's gaming platform offering consoles and games.
playstation: Sony's gaming platform offering consoles and games.
nintendo: Gaming company known for consoles and franchises like Mario.
blizzard: Developer known for games like World of Warcraft.
stream: Live streaming platform primarily for gamers.
game: Community platform focused on indie games.
kongregate: Online gaming platform hosting user-created games.
battle: Online gaming platform by Blizzard for multiplayer games.
gog: Digital distribution platform known for DRM-free games.
origin: Digital distribution platform by Electronic Arts.

valorant: Tactical first-person shooter developed by Riot Games.
rocket: Hybrid soccer-video game combining cars and football.
counter: Multi-player first-person shooter video game series.
fifa: Popular football simulation video game series.
skype: VoIP software providing video chat and voice call services.

wordpress: Content management system for creating blogs and websites.
medium: Hosting platform for writers to publish content.
blogger: A blog-publishing service that allows multi-user blogs.
tumblr: A microblogging platform and social network.
ghost: Software that allows you to create a blog or website.
wix: Website builder that allows users to create their websites.
weebly: Website builder suitable for blogs, portfolios, and e-commerce.
post: Localized platform for blogging and personal websites.
livejournal: Social network built around constantly updated blogs.
micro: Platform focused on microblogging and social networking.

guest: Service connecting guest bloggers with websites.

microsoft: Suite of productivity applications from Microsoft.
google: Cloud-based productivity suite with apps like Docs and Sheets.
slack: Collaboration tool that combines messaging and task management.
zoom: Video conferencing and online meeting platform.
trello: Project management tool for organizing tasks.
canvas: Learning management system for educational institutions.
evernote: Note-taking app that helps users organize notes and tasks.
canva: Graphic design platform for creating social media graphics.

airtable: Organizational tool for creating spreadsheets and databases.
jira: Project management tool for agile teams.

gimp: Open-source image editor similar to Photoshop.
github: Platform for version control and collaboration.
gitlab: Web-based DevOps lifecycle tool that provides a Git repository.
bitbucket: Web-based version control repository hosting service owned by Atlassian.
stackoverflow: Question and answer site for professional and enthusiast programmers.
clickup: Project management tool with collaboration features.
notion: A versatile tool for documents, tasks, and databases.
whimsical: Collaborative tool for wireframing and mind mapping.
